dt-option.name: searchBuilder.depthLimit
dt-option.summary: Impose a limit on the depth of the groups

type.description: The value for how many layers deep a group can be at most.
When false, don't impose a limit on the depth of groups.

dt-option.default: The default value for the `-init searchBuilder.depthLimit` option is `false` meaning that as standard there will be no limit on the depth of the groups.
dt-option.description:
This option allows for a limit to be set on how deep sub groups can be placed from the top level. The top level is considered the first level. Setting a `-init searchBuilder.depthLimit` of 2 would allow for criteria to be indented by 1 level as this would then be at the second level - the limit.
As default the limit is false, meaning that criteria can be indented as far as desired.
Take a look at [this example]([../extensions/SearchBuilder/examples/initialisation/depthLimit.html) to see this in action.
